text.tspan: The soldiers and harriers in the story of Fidelion wear gas masks for the sake
of either protecting their identity from severe negative repercussions or
providing fear to their enemies. The color red symbolizes the meaning of
Fidelia’s gas mask seems to occupy alternate
roles depending on their context as
or for individuals dissenting from a power
structure. Fidelia’s gas mask aesthetic is a
feeling of dread and the implication of
The Titan serves as a significant addition to the Fidelian
Empire of battlefields. The two-legged beast is armed with a
single protracted canon and two beaming lights in the front.
The Fidelian Empire uses the Titan through their battles
against their enemies. The Titan moves through engine and
Under Jake’s command, an aide and brilliant engineer
developed an even more powerful military technology. They
eventually created a destructive weapon of absolute power as

and General Celine Adelle had a strong
Even before the war, Rowan served as
Jake's right-hand man and still is the best
Celine, a woman who was found in an
ordinary village, caught Jake's eye and
broke out on the map of Fidelia. Although
she had no military experience, she was
more than capable of leading Fidelian's
army. She became a general immediately.
For years, the Empire ruled through fear,
such as Kossacks and Hunters, Jake
The Fidelian army is highly trained and ready to combat any threat. People's understanding of Fidelian's military is
limited to what they have learned. The Fidelian army has its own culture, language, and military practices. The
Fidelian army may appear overwhelming, strict, and intimidating to those who have had little or no personal
The Fidelion is established like a vertical society, where
your status rises as you move up the social ladder. The
Fidelion is both a fort and an oil drilling device.
It stands in the center of Fidelia and has three pillars
that support the machine's base. It continuously pumps
oil. Jake Marcus views crude as valuable as gold. Not
only he but everybody values oil as gold.
The master and Jake's rooms are in the middle and the
top structure in Fidelion. Jake can see Fidelia's people
and the city up close from his balcony. Jake is making
announcements, living large, and controlling this
Jake eventually raids the surrounding villages, forcing them to join their army
and work for them. People around him have already noticed that his greed
has become excessive, as opposed to before. However, they still follow him
Jake, who initially showed favoritism toward the village, gradually began to
treat them as a colony. The town was attacked and forcibly annexed, the
strong men became slaves and soldiers, and the women and children became
The Texas city he discovered thrived.
improved, and they are now entering
a period of relatively stable growth.
Jake, on the other hand, wanted
more as he grew older. He needed
The workers are represented in the lower left corner of the logo, the
pipe that distributes the oil is represented in the middle, and the
armies and soldiers are represented in the right corner of the logo.
These three bars are assisting Fidelion.
The central part of the logo is like
the heart of Fidelion, an empire
The upper part of the logo is the oil factory,
where Fidelia is developing and pumping oil
In Fidelia, there is no such thing as a
middle class. There are only upper
and lower classes, with Jake’s desire
to separate himself from the lower
class and prevent the lower class
citizens from crossing over. The army
created this rule to show the city they
are more robust and are elevating to
Jake and Jake’s followers discovered that oil would be
the most crucial resource for the current human
population. With powerful EMPs from the nuclear war,
all electronic devices lost their functions, and most pre-
war internal combustion engines that used electronic
devices could not be used. Fortunately, machines with
mechanical control devices preserved knowledge, and
older engines were installed. Production was also
possible. Naturally, the survival of humanity’s interest
was to secure ‘fuel’ to run the engine along with food
After a long journey, Jake and his followers finally
established a new civilization by restarting oil drilling
activities. The settlement of their new journey caused a
massive upheaval by a group of bandits and gangsters.
They threatened and defeated Jake’s new home by
attacking the villagers and stealing their valuables.
Through various strategies and the motivation of
vengeance. Jake led his small group of army and decided
to bring back justice. Furthermore, Jake gained support
from his villagers. Jake decided to use every strength
within his ability to advance toward his dreams.
One day, a riot breaks out inside the underworld due to a
shortage of resources. Although he didn’t mean to, Jake
unintentionally plays the role of the person who started the
riot and became the rebels’ leader. He eventually emerges
from the underworld with remaining supplies and weapons
When a nuclear war broke out while Jake was 5 years old,
Jake and his parents took refuge in an underground bunker,
where they spent 15 years under strict control.
Jake was not the brightest kid of his age before, but through
this tragic event of humanity, he lost his smile, childhood, and
happiness. From then on, he didn’t understand the meaning of
His bizarre thinking manifested in deformed ways, such as mistreating
insects and animals. On the other hand, Jake was sharp-witted, had a
clear mind, and had a keen interest in and talent for art. His favorite
musical piece was Beethoven’s sole opera, “Fidelio,” which his mother
Before the war, Jake Marcus was an average kid growing up in a
wealthy family background. Jake was raised with higher-level ideas and
aristocratic-centered views; he found it difficult and was reluctant to
interact with regular people. During his formative years, he struggled
with confusion about justice and was mainly preoccupied with
2024 was when the world lost it’s hope.
Due to the indiscriminate bombing of
form. The system that created the society
and civilization was not working. The
world entered an era of lawlessness.
and 94% of humanity has gone through
hell from the post-war. Those who
Historically, war is always affected by
anger, but the pain lasts forever.
